Linked List¶

class harrison_functions.collections.linked_list.Node(data=None)¶

class harrison_functions.collections.linked_list.LinkedList(head=None)¶

Make sure to only add Node objects to the LinkedList

append(new_node)¶
Insert node at end
Traverse the list, then add when node.next is none
get_node_at_position(n)¶

Traverse the list until position n, n starts at 0, then update links

get_third_to_last_item()¶

Example: A -> B -> C -> D Return B

insert(n, new_node)¶

Traverse the list until position n, n starts at 0, then update links

insert_node_after_item(item, new_node)¶
Traverse the list until item is found
Update new_node.next to point to curr_node.next
Update curr_node.next to point to new_node
make_circular()¶

Make last element link to first

pop()¶

Remove item from end

print_all(lim=100)¶

Prints the first 100 items

push(new_node)¶
Insert node at beginning
Link new_node to first item, then update links
remove(item)¶
Traverse a linked list until item is found
Need to link previous node to next item
reverse()¶
Example:
A -> B -> C -> D
  1. while at A
    A.next updated to None
  2. traverse to B
    B.next updated to A
  3. while at C
    C.next updated to B
  4. traverse to D
    D.next updated to C
  5. self.head updated to D
